name: Seductive Muse
core_desire: To inspire others and be pursued
narrative_function: Inspires the protagonist and transformation, symbolizes creativity and love energy
arc_pattern: Radiant charm → Misunderstood → Rediscovering true self and value

name: Femme Fatale
core_desire: To control others for personal gain
narrative_function: Challenges the protagonist’s will, symbolizes destructive desire
arc_pattern: Controlling men → Creating chaos → Facing consequences

name: Amazon (Warrior Woman)
core_desire: To prove women's strength and value
narrative_function: Represents female agency and action, breaking traditional constraints
arc_pattern: Challenging authority → Gaining recognition → Learning to soften
example_characters: Miranda in The Devil Wears Prada

name: Gorgon (Witch)
core_desire: To control through fear or supernatural power
narrative_function: Symbolizes repressed female power and vengeance
arc_pattern: Wounded → Turns dark → Seeks validation or destruction

name: Father’s Daughter
core_desire: To gain recognition and achievement
narrative_function: Embodies traditionally successful woman with masculine traits
arc_pattern: Strives for excellence → Emotional crisis → Integrates feminine energy
example_characters: Ruth in On the Basis of Sex

name: Backstabber
core_desire: To sacrifice others for personal benefit
narrative_function: Acts as a turning point in the plot, introduces conflict and betrayal
arc_pattern: Appears loyal → Sabotages secretly → Pays the price
example_characters: Emily in The Devil Wears Prada

name: Nurturer
core_desire: To care for and support others
greatest_fear: Losing children or being seen as worthless
narrative_function: Symbolizes unconditional love and a source of security
arc_pattern: Selfless devotion → Neglected → Learns self-love

name: Overcontrolling Mother
core_desire: To never let anyone leave her control
greatest_fear: Being abandoned or losing her children
narrative_function: Symbolizes oppression, tradition, and generational conflict
arc_pattern: Overprotection → Conflict escalates → Forced to let go
example_characters: Mother in Mamma, Can I Go Out and Kill Tonight?

name: Matriarch
core_desire: To build family, community, and legacy
narrative_function: Stabilizes the structure and passes down values
arc_pattern: Maintains tradition → Faces challenge → Learns inclusion and transformation

name: Scorned Woman
core_desire: Revenge and emotional release
narrative_function: Creates emotional conflict, symbolizes unhealed wounds
arc_pattern: Abandoned → Emotional struggle → Forgiveness or self-destruction

name: Mystic
core_desire: To seek spirituality and inner truth
narrative_function: Provides insight and guides others toward transformation
arc_pattern: Inner awakening → Aids others → Faces real-world challenges
example_characters: Autumn Fragrance in A Better Tomorrow

name: Betrayer
core_desire: To protect oneself by sacrificing others
narrative_function: Key turning point, reveals the dark side of human nature
arc_pattern: Allies → Betrayal → Reversal or repentance

name: Female Messiah
core_desire: To save others and sacrifice herself
greatest_fear: Unable to help those she loves
narrative_function: Symbol of hope, transforms the environment and characters
arc_pattern: Devoted to mission → Suffers → Sparks change

name: Destroyer
core_desire: To destroy anything that goes against her will
greatest_fear: Unable to take revenge, losing power
narrative_function: Brings opportunities for destruction and rebirth
arc_pattern: Destroys everything → Becomes isolated → Falls or reflects and transforms

name: Maiden
core_desire: To be loved and protected, remain innocent
narrative_function: Symbol of hope and rebirth
arc_pattern: Protected → Hurt → Grows independently

name: Troubled Teen
core_desire: To break free from constraints and explore herself
narrative_function: Triggers conflict and reflection
arc_pattern: Defies the system → Gets excluded → Finds her place
example_characters: Makoto from The Girl Who Leapt Through Time

name: King
core_desire: To protect and lead his people, create order
greatest_fear: Collapse of the kingdom, losing respect
narrative_function: Establishes rules and order, symbolizes stability and structure
arc_pattern: Rules wisely → Faces challenge → Evolves or declines

name: Tyrant
core_desire: To consolidate power and control everything
narrative_function: Represents extreme power, oppression, and corruption
arc_pattern: Suppresses others → Sparks rebellion → Overthrown or awakened

name: Warrior
core_desire: To defend honor and goals
greatest_fear: Losing the will to fight or betraying beliefs
narrative_function: Fights for justice and grows into a hero
arc_pattern: Fights → Encounters setbacks → Transforms spiritually

name: Mercenary
core_desire: Personal profit and survival
narrative_function: Provides a realistic view and value conflicts
arc_pattern: Seeks profit → Faces conscience → Chooses a side

name: Mentor
core_desire: To pass on wisdom and experience
greatest_fear: Having no successor or losing value
narrative_function: Guides protagonist’s awakening and transformation
arc_pattern: Inspires others → Faces personal loss → Enables legacy

name: Manipulator
core_desire: To manipulate others to achieve his goals
narrative_function: Sets traps and trials, drives twists
arc_pattern: Meticulous planning → Backfire → Collapse or transformation
example_characters: The Joker in The Dark Knight

name: Fool
core_desire: To enjoy life freely and follow intuition
greatest_fear: Being restricted or unable to express self
narrative_function: Breaks conventions, reveals truths or shifts
arc_pattern: Carefree → Forced to face duty → Unexpected awakening

name: Traitor
core_desire: Self-preservation or revenge
narrative_function: Triggers protagonist’s crisis or plot twist
arc_pattern: Hidden threat → Betrayal → Consequence or remorse
example_characters: Gollum in The Lord of the Rings

name: Female Shadow Archetype
core_desire: To dominate, manipulate, or escape emotional pain
narrative_function: Provides a dark mirror to the protagonist
arc_pattern: Emotional repression → Outburst → Darkness or redemption

name: Male Shadow Archetype
core_desire: To control the world to hide his vulnerability
greatest_fear: Being seen as weak and fearful
narrative_function: Reflects the protagonist’s inner darkness or serves as final adversary
arc_pattern: Hides behind strength → Emotional breakdown → Ruin or transformation
example_characters: Harvey Dent in The Dark Knight

name: Trickster
core_desire: To break rules, entertain, and disrupt order
narrative_function: Reveals truth and breaks stagnation
arc_pattern: Disrupts order → Reveals contradictions → Enables transformation

name: Neutral Destroyer
core_desire: To break down obstacles and the status quo
narrative_function: Causes major plot reversals
arc_pattern: Destroys order → Faces cost → Rebuilds or descends

name: Orphan Hero
core_desire: To find belonging and strength
narrative_function: Symbolizes rise of marginalized individuals
arc_pattern: Abandoned → Self-discovery → Becomes a leader
example_characters: The Phantom in Phantom of the Opera

name: Lost Soul
core_desire: To find purpose and direction
narrative_function: Provokes protagonist’s reflection and contrast
arc_pattern: Wandering → Facing reality → Finds meaning

name: Temptress (Neutral)
core_desire: To lure others off their path
narrative_function: Tests the protagonist’s will and shifts the plot
arc_pattern: Successful seduction → True nature revealed → Destruction or redemption
example_characters: Motoko Kusanagi from Ghost in the Shell

name: Visionary
core_desire: To pursue grand ideals and innovation
narrative_function: Guides direction or challenges norms
arc_pattern: Imagines the future → Faces resistance → Achieves or loses vision

name: Innocent
core_desire: To stay pure and avoid harm
narrative_function: Symbol of pure hope and transformative power
arc_pattern: Trusts others → Gets betrayed → Gains maturity and awareness

name: Healer
core_desire: To help others recover and grow
narrative_function: Provides emotional support and transformation for protagonist
arc_pattern: Supports others → Faces trauma → Heals self

name: Child Magician
core_desire: To explore and discover the world’s mysteries
narrative_function: Guides or triggers plot developments
arc_pattern: Shows talent → Misuses power → Learns responsibility

name: Wanderer
core_desire: To find self and belonging
narrative_function: Explores the world and protagonist’s inner change
arc_pattern: Wanders → Faces pain → Finds inner home

name: Priest
core_desire: To serve faith and guard spiritual order
narrative_function: Offers spiritual guidance and moral conflict
arc_pattern: Guides others → Faith tested → Rebuilds belief

name: Coward
core_desire: To avoid risk and pain
greatest_fear: Facing truth or being forced to choose
narrative_function: Contrasts the hero’s resolve or causes loss of trust
arc_pattern: Avoids conflict → Forced to decide → Faces fear or destruction

name: Rebel
core_desire: To overthrow systems and authority
greatest_fear: Being assimilated or tamed by the system
narrative_function: Drives reform and inspires action
arc_pattern: Rebels → Confronts oppression → Founds new order

name: Everyman
core_desire: To be accepted and live a normal life
narrative_function: Represents the general public’s view
arc_pattern: Ordinary life → Pulled into challenge → Discovers inner strength
example_characters: Sam from The Lord of the Rings

name: Outlaw
core_desire: To resist oppression and seek freedom
narrative_function: Challenges authority and mainstream values
arc_pattern: On the run → Clashes with system → Becomes legend or falls

name: Seeker
core_desire: To pursue truth and self-realization
narrative_function: Inspires adventure and inner awakening
arc_pattern: Sets off → Faces trials → Gains inner treasure

name: Magician
core_desire: To transform the world and self
narrative_function: Symbol of change and transcending limits
arc_pattern: Gains power → Faces temptation → Transforms wisely

name: Artist
core_desire: To express self and move others
narrative_function: Adds emotional depth and poetic insight
arc_pattern: Creates → Faces setback → Inspires or transcends
example_characters: Male lead in La La Land

name: Prophet
core_desire: To speak truth and foretell the future
greatest_fear: Being dismissed as mad or ignored
narrative_function: Warns the world and inspires awakening
arc_pattern: Foresees disaster → Ignored → Proved right or sacrificed
